title: 75/6. Report of the International Atomic Energy Agency

paragraphs.1: Takes note with appreciation of the report of the International Atomic Energy Agency;
paragraphs.2: Takes note of resolutions GC(64)/RES/3 on the Agency and the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic; GC(64)/RES/9 on nuclear and radiation safety; GC(64)/RES/10 on nuclear security; GC(64)/RES/11 on the strengthening of the Agency’s technical cooperation activities; GC(64)/RES/12 on strengthening the Agency’s activities related to nuclear science, technology and applications, comprising GC(64)/RES/12 A on non-power nuclear applications, GC(64)/RES/12 B on nuclear power applications and GC(64)/RES/12 C on nuclear knowledge management; GC(64)/RES/13 on strengthening the effectiveness and improving the efficiency of Agency safeguards; GC(64)/RES/14 on the implementation of the Agreement between the Agency and the Democratic People’s Republic of Korea for the application of safeguards in connection with the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons; and GC(64)/RES/15 on the application of Agency safeguards in the Middle East; and decisions GC(64)/DEC/10 on the amendment to article XIV.A of the statute of the Agency; and GC(64)/DEC/11 on the promotion of efficiency and effectiveness of the Agency’s decision-making process, adopted by the General Conference of the Agency at its sixty-fourth regular session, held from 21 to 25 September 2020;
paragraphs.3: Reaffirms its strong support for the indispensable role of the Agency in encouraging and assisting the development and practical application of atomic energy for peaceful uses, in technology transfer to developing countries and in nuclear safety, verification and security;
paragraphs.4: Welcomes resolution GC(SPL.2)/RES/1 on the approval of the appointment of Mr. Rafael Mariano Grossi as Director General of the Agency from 3 December 2019 to 2 December 2023, adopted by the General Conference of the Agency at its second special session, held on 2 December 2019;
paragraphs.5: Expresses appreciation for the leadership of the Director General and for the professionalism of the staff of the Agency during the COVID-19 pandemic;
paragraphs.6: Appeals to Member States to continue to support the activities of the Agency;
paragraphs.7: Requests the Secretary-General to transmit to the Director General of the Agency the records of the seventy-fifth session of the General Assembly relating to the activities of the Agency.
